faqs.question: What is the typical price range for a residential Plot For Sale in Sector 45 Gurugram
faqs.answer: Pricing for residential plots in Sector 45 varies significantly based on size exact location within the sector road width and whether the plot is corner-facing or park-facing. Generally Sector 45 commands premium pricing due to its established infrastructure and central location. Smaller 4 to 6 Marla plots represent the entry segment while larger plots 10 Marla and above fall into the high-end luxury bracket. We advise consulting our current price list for the most up-to-date and site-specific valuations.

faqs.question: Are the plots in Sector 45 freehold or leasehold properties
faqs.answer: The residential plots available in Sector 45 Gurugram are predominantly freehold properties meaning the buyer owns the land outright forever with full rights to transfer inherit or sell the asset without needing external governmental permission for every transaction. This freehold status is a major factor driving investor confidence and ensures long-term property security and liquidity.

faqs.question: What are the permissible construction limits on a residential plot in Sector 45
faqs.answer: Construction limits in Sector 45 are governed by the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram MCG building bylaws. Generally you are permitted to build up to four independent floors on a residential plot provided you adhere to the mandated floor area ratio FAR setback requirements and ground coverage regulations. These rules ensure uniformity and safety across the sector. Our experts can provide you with the latest detailed construction guidelines based on the plot size you select.

faqs.question: Is Sector 45 safe and how is the local security infrastructure
faqs.answer: Sector 45 is widely regarded as one of the safer and more organized residential sectors in Gurugram. It benefits from well-lit internal roads active resident welfare associations RWAs and robust surveillance systems often implemented by individual homeowners and community initiatives. Its proximity to major institutional areas also contributes to heightened general security and efficient policing.

faqs.question: Are there any immediate infrastructure projects near Sector 45 that might impact plot value
faqs.answer: Sector 45 is largely insulated from major disruptive infrastructure construction as it is a fully developed sector. faqs.question: What documents are required to verify the legal status of a Plot For Sale in Sector 45
faqs.answer: To legally verify a plot you must examine several key documents including the original Sale Deed or Conveyance Deed confirming ownership the latest Mutation document showing updated ownership in government records the Non-Encumbrance Certificate EC ensuring the property is free from legal liabilities and the site layout plan approved by the relevant authority. We assist in gathering and verifying all these documents thoroughly.

faqs.question: How soon can I start construction after purchasing a plot in this sector
faqs.answer: Once the plot is registered in your name and you have obtained the necessary building plan approvals from the local civic body MCG you can commence construction immediately. The timeline usually depends on how quickly the building plan approval is secured which typically takes a few weeks assuming all required documentation is in order. We help streamline the approval process.

faqs.question: Does the Sector 45 area experience regular water or electricity shortages
faqs.answer: As an established and premium sector Sector 45 enjoys superior municipal services. Water supply is generally reliable and regulated by the Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran HSVP while electricity infrastructure is robust minimizing frequent power disruptions. Most plots also have provision for private backup power solutions further ensuring continuous utility access.

faqs.question: Can non-residents or NRIs purchase a Plot For Sale in Sector 45 Gurugram
faqs.answer: Yes NRIs and foreign nationals of Indian origin are legally permitted to purchase residential immovable property in India including plots in Sector 45 Gurugram. The purchasing process is governed by FEMA regulations and generally involves utilizing NRE or NRO accounts for transactions. Our team is experienced in handling NRI transactions providing specialized legal and financial guidance.

faqs.question: What are the associated closing costs beyond the plot purchase price
faqs.answer: Beyond the basic price of the Plot For Sale in Sector 45 you must budget for stamp duty and registration charges which are mandatory fees paid to the state government. You will also incur legal fees documentation charges and brokerage commissions if applicable. These closing costs typically range between 5 percent to 8 percent of the total transaction value depending on current state government rates and policies.
